content.title: Arterial Ligation Indications
content.description: When arterial ligation is appropriate in trauma

key_concepts.details: Internal iliac, hypogastric, profunda femoris, isolated tibial arteries, radial/ulnar (if collateral intact)
Common femoral, superficial femoral, popliteal, brachial (arm viability at risk)
Physiologic exhaustion (hypothermia, acidosis, coagulopathy); contaminated field
Alternative to ligation; allows delayed definitive repair; Javid, Pruitt-Inahara shunts

content.clinical_significance: Decision based on patient physiology and specific arterial location
